    • Method Detail

      • sendRequest

        protected java.lang.Void sendRequest(Connection rConnection,
                                     java.io.OutputStream rOutput,
                                     java.io.InputStream rInput,
                                     Email rEmail)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Sends the request through the socket and processes the response. The standard implementation invokes SocketEndpoint.SocketRequest.writeRequest(Connection, OutputStream, Object) and SocketEndpoint.SocketRequest.readResponse(Connection, InputStream). Subclasses may alternatively override this method, e.g. for more complex requests that need to perform some kind of handshake.
        Overrides:
        sendRequest in class SocketEndpoint.SocketRequest<Email,java.lang.Void>
        Parameters:
        rConnection - The connection for the current request
        rOutput - The output stream to send the request through
        rInput - The input stream to read the response from
        rEmail - The request data to send
        Returns:
        The processed response
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Any exception may be thrown to indicate errors
